Others: Chile and Brazil have a 100-year history of footballing rivalry.
Chile has enjoyed recent continental success with back-to-back Copa America wins in 2015 and 2016.
Brazil has won the Copa America nine times and has a favorable head-to-head record against Chile.
The two nations have met in some huge fixtures over the past 100 years, including four encounters at the World Cup finals.
Brazil has dominated Chile in their recent meetings, with 17 wins in the last 20 encounters.
The last 20 meetings between the two teams include a 1-2 loss for Chile against Brazil on October 10, 2024.
